link.title: Lakeside Elementary School - News

form.name: aspnetForm

span.p: All schools are closed until further notice, by order of the State Board of Education. Effective March 25, 2020, Governor Brad Little has issued a Stay-at-Home order for 21 days. On April 15, 2020, Governor Little extended that order through April 30, 2020.

td.span: Welcome To Lakeside! Home of the 2020 High School Boys State 1A Division II Basketball Champions

em.span: Welcome to Plummer-Worley Joint School District #44.

span.strong: Effective Wednesday, March 18, 2020, until further notice. ***

span.p: The Idaho State Board of Education voted today to extend the “soft closure” of all public schools to the end of this school year, or until local and state social distancing orders have been lifted by authorities.

The “soft closure” means that we can’t provide instruction in school buildings because of the COVID-19 pandemic. We are allowed to enact the remote learning and educational packets being put in place, and we will continue to deliver meals. School staff is prepared to continue teaching our students remotely through the end of this school year if necessary. Please follow all learning directions provided by Mr. Mitchell and Mrs. Hall.
The district and your school board are paying close attention to the situation. We miss your kids and want them back in school as soon as it is safe. Be healthy! Be safe!

span.span: for updated information on Grab & Go Meals, Parent/Teacher Conferences/Academics/Etc.

If you are having any problem with the tablets provided by the district, please call 686-1937 so we can help you to resolve the issue. Messages are checked frequently so it won't take someone long to get back to you.

span.p: Click HERE to connect to the Tyler SIS Student Portal

h6.span: Lakeside welcomes all students and families to the 2019-20 school year. We are working to make online registration available for returning families. Check back in a couple of weeks to see if it is available.

div.h6: If you are new to Lakeside, it is very important for you to come into the office to complete a request for records to be transferred from the previous school district. You can download the registration paperwork by clicking here:

div.a: Early Release May 8, @PWSD School District, Begins @ 1:00 PM
Board Meeting May 11, @PWSD School District, Begins @ 6:00 PM
Regular May 2020 Board Meeting May 11, @District Boardroom, Begins @ 6:00 PM
CDA Tribe Provides Backpacks and Supplies for All Students

span.p: Once again, the Coeur d'Alene Tribe has generously provided backpacks full of school supplies for all students enrolled at Lakeside. Each backpack is filled with appropriate supplies for their age/grade level. How lucky are we?!
Mr. Russ Mitchell has been selected by the Board of Trustees to be the new superintendent at Plummer-Worley School District beginning July 1, 2020.

Mr. Mitchell earned a BA in elementary education from Northwest Nazarene University in Nampa, Idaho, an MEd in Education Administration and Supervision from College of Idaho in Caldwell, and doctoral coursework and superintendent credentials from Gonzaga University in Spokane. His educational employment history includes Homedale (Idaho) School District, Kimberly (Idaho) School District, and Educational Service District 101 in Spokane. He also has numerous years of volunteer youth involvement including coaching various sports.

Russ is currently the principal at Lakeside Elementary and brings with him strong experience in teaching, administration, and technology. We are confident he will keep the forward momentum his predecessor Mrs. Sharrett has developed.

Lakeside has again been named a Community Eligibility Program by the USDA. This means that all students can eat breakfast and lunch for free. There is no need at this time for parents to complete the Free & Reduced application previously required.

a.title: Click to read more about: All Students Eat for Free

b.i: Working Together to Educate and Prepare Positive, Motivated, and Successful Citizens"
